_FICA_ss_trt.description: Social Security FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

_SS_Earnings_c.long_name: Maximum taxable earnings for Social Security
_SS_Earnings_c.description: Only individual earnings below this maximum amount are subjected to Social Security (OASDI) payroll tax.
_SS_Earnings_c.notes: This parameter is indexed by the rate of growth in average wages, not by the inflation rate.

_FICA_mc_trt.description: Medicare FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

_AMEDT_ec.description: The Additional Medicare Tax rate, _AMEDT_rt, applies to all earnings in excess of this excluded amount.

_AMEDT_rt.description: This is the rate applied to the portion of Medicare wages, RRTA compensation and self-employment income exceeding the Additional Medicare Tax earning exclusion.

_SS_thd50.long_name: Threshold for Social Security benefit taxability 1
_SS_thd50.description: The first threshold for Social Security benefit taxability: if taxpayers have provisional income greater than this threshold, up to 50% of their Social Security benefit will be subject to tax under current law.

_SS_percentage1.long_name: Social Security taxable income decimal fraction 1
_SS_percentage1.description: Under current law if their provisional income is above the first threshold for Social Security taxability but below the second threshold, taxpayers need to apply this fraction to both the excess of their provisional income over the first threshold and their Social Security benefits, and then include the smaller one in their AGI.
_SS_percentage1.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 20b, instructions (Social Security Worksheets, line 2 & 13)

_SS_thd85.long_name: Threshold for Social Security benefit taxability 2
_SS_thd85.description: The second threshold for Social Security taxability: if taxpayers have provisional income greater than this threshold, up to 85% of their Social Security benefit will be subject to tax under current law.
_SS_thd85.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 20a&b, calculation (Worksheet, add line 10 values to line 8).

_SS_percentage2.long_name: Social Security taxable income decimal fraction 2
_SS_percentage2.description: Under current law if their provisional income is above the second threshold for Social Security taxability, taxpayers need to apply this fraction to both the excess of their provisional income over the second threshold and their social security benefits, and then include the smaller one in their AGI.
_SS_percentage2.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 20b, instructions (Social Security Worksheets, line 15)

_ALD_StudentLoan_hc.long_name: Adjustment for student loan interest haircut
_ALD_StudentLoan_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the student loan interest adjustment allowed.
_ALD_StudentLoan_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount will be (1- Haircut) * Student Loan Interest.

_ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the employer equivalent portion of self-employment adjustment.
_ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * Self Employment Tax Adjustment.

_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.long_name: Adjustment for self employed health insurance haircut
_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the health insurance adjustment for self-employed taxpayers.
_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * self-employed health insurance adjustment.

_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_hc.long_name: Adjustment for payment to either KEOGH or SEP plan haircut
_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_hc.description: Under current law, payments to Keogh or SEP plans can be fully deducted from gross income. Taxpayers can use this haircut to limit the adjustment allowed.
_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount is (1 - Haircut) * KEOGH/SEP plan payments

_ALD_EarlyWithdraw_hc.long_name: Adjustment for forfeited interest penalty haircut
_ALD_EarlyWithdraw_hc.description: Under current law, early withdraw penalty can be fully deducted from gross income. Taxpayers can use this haircut to limit the adjustment allowed.
_ALD_EarlyWithdraw_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount is (1 - Haircut) * Early withdraw penalty

_ALD_Alimony_hc.description: Under current law, the full amount of alimony payment is taken as an adjustment from gross income in arriving at AGI. Taxpayers can use this haircut to limit the deduction allowed.
_ALD_Alimony_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * Alimony Payments

_ALD_EducatorExpenses_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of educator expenses that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_EducatorExpenses_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * Educator Expenses

_ALD_HSADeduction_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of a taxpayer's HSA deduction that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_HSADeduction_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * HSA Deduction

_ALD_IRAContributions_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of IRA contributions that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_IRAContributions_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * IRA Contribution

_ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.long_name: Deduction for domestic production activity haircut
_ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of domestic production activity that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * Domestic Production Activity

_ALD_Tuition_hc.long_name: Deduction for tuition and fees haircut
_ALD_Tuition_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of tuition and fees that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_Tuition_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Haircut) * Tuition and Fees

_ALD_InvInc_ec_rt.description: Decimal fraction of investment income base that can be excluded from AGI.
_ALD_InvInc_ec_rt.notes: The final taxable investment income will be (1-_ALD_InvInc_ec_rt)*investment_income_base. Even though the excluded portion of investment income is not included in AGI, it still is included in investment income used to calculate the Net Investment Income Tax and Earned Income Tax Credit.

_ALD_InvInc_ec_base_RyanBrady.long_name: Investment income exclusion base for Ryan-Brady tax blueprint
_ALD_InvInc_ec_base_RyanBrady.description: Exclusion is applied to long-term gains before loss limitation, taxable interest and qualified dividends. Interpretation of the sparsely-detailed Ryan-Brady provision.

_ALD_Dependents_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the portion of childcare costs that can be deducted from AGI
_ALD_Dependents_hc.notes: The final adjustment would be (1 - Haircut) * Average childcare costs

_ALD_Dependents_Child_c.long_name: National average childcare costs: ceiling for available childcare deduction.
_ALD_Dependents_Child_c.description: The weighted average of childcare costs in the US. 7165 is the weighted average from the 'Child Care in America: 2016 State Fact Sheets'
_ALD_Dependents_Child_c.notes: This is a weighted average of childcare costs in each state

_ALD_Dependents_Elder_c.long_name: Ceiling for elderly care deduction proposed in Trump's tax plan
_ALD_Dependents_Elder_c.description: A tax payer can take an above the line deduction up to this amount if they have an elderly dependent. The Trump 2016 campaign proposal was for $5000.

_ALD_Dependents_thd.long_name: Maximum level of income to qualify for the dependent care deduction
_ALD_Dependents_thd.description: A taxpayer can only claim the dependent care deduction if their total income is below this level. The Trump 2016 campaign proposal was for 250000 single, 500000 joint, 250000 separate, 500000 head of household].

_II_em.description: Subtracted from AGI in the calculation of taxable income, per taxpayer and dependent.

_II_em_ps.description: If taxpayers' AGI is above this level, their personal exemption will start to decrease at the personal exemption phaseout rate (PEP provision).

_II_prt.description: Personal exemption amount will decrease by this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding exemption phaseout start.

_STD.notes: This parameter cannot be decreased due to lack of data.

_STD_Dep.description: This is the maximum standard deduction for dependents.
_STD_Dep.notes: This parameter cannot be decreased due to lack of data.

_STD_Aged.long_name: Additional standard deduction for blind and aged
_STD_Aged.description: To get the standard deduction for aged or blind individuals, taxpayers need to add this value to regular standard deduction
_STD_Aged.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 40, calculation (the difference of the two tables given in the instruction).

_II_credit.description: This credit amount is fully refundable and phased out based on AGI. It is available to tax units who would otherwise not file.

_II_credit_ps.description: The Personal Refundable credit amount will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this level.

_II_credit_prt.description: The Personal Refundable credit amount will be reduced at this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding the _II_credit_ps threshold.

_ID_Medical_frt.long_name: Deduction for medical expenses; floor as a decimal fraction of AGI
_ID_Medical_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their medical expense exceeding this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Medical_frt.notes: This rate cannot be decreased to lower than 0.1 due to limited data on non-itemizers.

_ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.long_name: Addon to the deduction for medical expenses floor rate for elderly filing units; addon as a decimal fraction of AGI
_ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.description: Elderly taxpayers have this fraction added to the value of the deduction for medical expenses floor rate.  This fraction was -0.025 from 2013 to 2016, but that was temporary and it changed to zero beginning in 2017.
_ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.notes: This addon cannot be decreased to lower than -0.025 due to limited data on elderly non-itemizers.

_ID_Medical_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of medical expense deduction allowed.
_ID_Medical_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate this part of itemized deduction.

_ID_StateLocalTax_hc.long_name: State and local taxes (Income and Sales) deduction haircut.
_ID_StateLocalTax_hc.description: This decimal fraction reduces the state and local tax deduction.
_ID_StateLocalTax_hc.section_2: State and local income and sales taxes
_ID_StateLocalTax_hc.notes: This parameter allows for the implementation of Option 51 from https://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/cbofiles/attachments/49638-BudgetOptions.pdf.

_ID_RealEstate_hc.description: This decimal fraction reduces real estate taxes paid eligible to deduct in itemized deduction.
_ID_RealEstate_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate real estate taxes paid itemized deduction.

_ID_InterestPaid_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of interest deduction allowed.
_ID_InterestPaid_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate this part of itemized deduction.

_ID_Charity_crt_all.long_name: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for all charitable contribution deductions
_ID_Charity_crt_all.description: The total deduction for charity is capped at this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Charity_crt_all.irs_ref: Pub. 526, Limits on Deductions: 50% Limit Organizations.
_ID_Charity_crt_all.notes: This rate cannot be increased to higher 0.5 due to lack of data.

_ID_Charity_crt_noncash.long_name: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for noncash charitable contribution deductions
_ID_Charity_crt_noncash.description: The deduction for noncash charity contributions is capped at this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Charity_crt_noncash.irs_ref: Pub 526, Limits on Deductions: Special 30% Limit for Capital Gain Property.
_ID_Charity_crt_noncash.notes: This rate cannot be increased to higher than 0.3 due to lack of data.

_ID_Charity_frt.long_name: Deduction for charitable contributions; floor as a decimal fraction of AGI
_ID_Charity_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their charitable expense exceeding this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Charity_frt.notes: This parameter allows for implementation of Option 52 from https://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/cbofiles/attachments/49638-BudgetOptions.pdf.

_ID_Charity_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of charity expense deduction allowed.
_ID_Charity_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate this part of itemized deduction.

_ID_Casualty_frt.long_name: Deduction for casualty loss; floor as a decimal fraction of AGI
_ID_Casualty_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their casualty loss exceeding this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Casualty_frt.notes: This rate cannot be decreased to lower than 0.1 due to lack of data.

_ID_Casualty_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of casualty expense deduction allowed.
_ID_Casualty_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate this part of itemized deduction.

_ID_Miscellaneous_frt.long_name: Deduction for miscellaneous expenses; floor as a decimal fraction of AGI
_ID_Miscellaneous_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their miscellaneous expense exceeding this fraction of AGI.
_ID_Miscellaneous_frt.notes: This rate cannot be decreased to lower than 0.02 due to lack of data.

_ID_Miscellaneous_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of miscellaneous expense deduction allowed.
_ID_Miscellaneous_hc.notes: This parameter is currently used to eliminate this part of itemized deduction.

_ID_ps.long_name: Itemized deduction phaseout AGI start (Pease provision)
_ID_ps.description: The itemized deductions will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this level.

_ID_prt.description: Taxpayers will not be eligible to deduct the full amount of itemized deduction if their AGI is above the phaseout start. The deductible portion would be decreased at this rate for each dollar exceeding the start.
_ID_prt.notes: This phaseout rate cannot be lower than 0.03 for each dollar, due to limited data on non-itemizers.

_ID_crt.long_name: Itemized deduction maximum phaseout as a decimal fraction of total itemized deductions (Pease)
_ID_crt.description: The phaseout amount is capped at this fraction of the original total deduction.
_ID_crt.notes: The ceiling rate cannot be increased above 0.8 due to limited data on non-itemizers.

_ID_BenefitSurtax_trt.long_name: Surtax rate on the benefits from specified itemized deductions
_ID_BenefitSurtax_trt.description: The benefit from specified itemized deductions exceeding the credit is taxed at this rate. A surtax rate of 1 strictly limits the benefit from specified itemized deductions to the specified credit. In http://www.nber.org/papers/w16921, Feldstein, Feenberg, and MacGuineas propose a credit of 2% of AGI against a 100% tax rate; in their proposal, however, a broader set of tax benefits, including the employer provided health exclusion, would be taxed.
_ID_BenefitSurtax_trt.section_2: Surtax on itemized deduction benefits above an AGI threshold

_ID_BenefitSurtax_crt.long_name: Credit on itemized deduction benefit surtax (decimal fraction of AGI)
_ID_BenefitSurtax_crt.description: The surtax on specified itemized deductions applies to benefits in excess of this fraction of AGI. In http://www.nber.org/papers/w16921, Feldstein, Feenberg, and MacGuineas propose a credit of 2% of AGI against a 100% tax rate; in their proposal, however, a broader set of tax benefits, including the employer provided health exclusion, would be taxed.
_ID_BenefitSurtax_crt.section_2: Surtax on itemized deduction benefits above an AGI threshold

_ID_BenefitSurtax_em.long_name: Exemption for itemized deduction benefit surtax (dollar AGI threshold)
_ID_BenefitSurtax_em.description: This amount is subtracted from itemized deduction benefits in the calculation of the itemized deduction benefit surtax. With _ID_BenefitSurtax_crt set to 0.0 and _ID_BenefitSurtax_trt set to 1.0, this amount serves as a dollar limit on the value of itemized deductions.
_ID_BenefitSurtax_em.section_2: Surtax on itemized deduction benefits above an AGI threshold

_ID_BenefitSurtax_Switch.long_name: Deductions subject to the surtax on itemized deduction benefits
_ID_BenefitSurtax_Switch.description: The surtax on itemized deduction benefits applies to the benefits derived from the itemized deductions specified with this parameter.
_ID_BenefitSurtax_Switch.section_2: Surtax on itemized deduction benefits above an AGI threshold

_ID_BenefitCap_rt.long_name: Ceiling on the benefits from itemized deductions; decimal fraction of total deductible expenses
_ID_BenefitCap_rt.description: The benefit from specified itemized deductions is capped at this percent of the total deductible expenses.
_ID_BenefitCap_rt.section_2: Ceiling on the benefit of itemized deductions as a percent of deductible expenses

_ID_BenefitCap_Switch.long_name: Deductions subject to the cap on itemized deduction benefits
_ID_BenefitCap_Switch.description: The cap on itemized deduction benefits applies to the benefits derived from the itemized deductions specified with this parameter.
_ID_BenefitCap_Switch.section_2: Ceiling on the benefit of itemized deductions as a percent of deductible expenses

_ID_c.long_name: Ceiling on the amount of itemized deductions allowed (dollars)
_ID_c.description: The amount of itemized deductions is limited to this dollar amount.
_ID_c.section_2: Ceiling on the amount of itemized deductions allowed

_CG_rt1.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 1
_CG_rt1.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are below threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
_CG_rt1.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_rt1.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 20, in-line.

_CG_brk1.long_name: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 1
_CG_brk1.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this are taxed at capital gain rate 1.
_CG_brk1.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_brk1.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 15, in-line.

_CG_rt2.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 2
_CG_rt2.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are below threshold 2 and above threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
_CG_rt2.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_rt2.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 29, in-line.

_CG_brk2.long_name: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 2
_CG_brk2.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this and above top of bracket 1 are taxed at capital gain rate 2.
_CG_brk2.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_brk2.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 24, in-line.

_CG_rt3.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 3
_CG_rt3.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 2 and below threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
_CG_rt3.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_rt3.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 32, in-line.

_CG_brk3.long_name: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividend tax (regular/non-AMT) bracket 3
_CG_brk3.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this and above top of bracket 2 are taxed at the capital gain rate 3; above this they are taxed at capital gain rate 4.  Default value is essentially infinity.
_CG_brk3.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_CG_brk3.irs_ref: Form 1040 Schedule D tax worksheet, line 24, in-line.

_CG_rt4.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 4
_CG_rt4.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
_CG_rt4.section_2: Regular - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_rt1.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 1
_AMT_CG_rt1.description: Capital gain and qualified dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
_AMT_CG_rt1.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_brk1.long_name: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (AMT) tax bracket 1
_AMT_CG_brk1.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 1.
_AMT_CG_brk1.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_rt2.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 2
_AMT_CG_rt2.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends
_AMT_CG_rt2.description: Capital gain and qualified dividend (stacked on top of regular income) below threshold 2 and above threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.

_AMT_CG_brk2.long_name: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (AMT) tax bracket 2
_AMT_CG_brk2.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this threshold and above bracket 1 are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 2.
_AMT_CG_brk2.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_rt3.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 3
_AMT_CG_rt3.description: The capital gain and qualified dividend (stacked on top of regular income) above threshold 2 and below threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
_AMT_CG_rt3.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_brk3.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) threshold 3
_AMT_CG_brk3.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this and above bracket 2 are taxed at capital gain rate 3; above thisthey are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 4.  Default value is essentially infinity.
_AMT_CG_brk3.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_AMT_CG_rt4.long_name: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 4
_AMT_CG_rt4.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
_AMT_CG_rt4.section_2: AMT - Long term capital gains and qualified dividends

_CG_nodiff.long_name: Long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income
_CG_nodiff.description: Specifies whether or not long term capital gains and qualified dividends are taxed like regular taxable income.
_CG_nodiff.section_2: Tax all capital gains and dividends the same as regular taxable income
_CG_nodiff.irs_ref: Current-law value is zero implying different tax treatment in Schedule D and AMT; a value of one implies same tax treatment in both regular and alternative minimum tax rules, but the same treatment can differ for regular and AMT.

_CG_ec.long_name: Dollar amount of all capital gains and qualified dividends that are excluded from AGI.
_CG_ec.description: Positive value used only if long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income.
_CG_ec.section_2: Tax all capital gains and dividends the same as regular taxable income

_CG_reinvest_ec_rt.long_name: Fraction of all capital gains and qualified dividends in excess of the dollar exclusion that are excluded from AGI.
_CG_reinvest_ec_rt.description: Positive value used only if long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income.  To limit the exclusion to capital gains and dividends invested within 1 year, set to statutory exclusion rate times the fraction of capital gains and qualified dividends in excess of the exclusion that are assumed to be reinvested within the year.
_CG_reinvest_ec_rt.section_2: Tax all capital gains and dividends the same as regular taxable income

_II_rt1.description: The lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 1.

_II_brk1.description: Taxable income below this threshold is taxed at tax rate 1.

_II_rt2.description: The second lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 2 and above tax bracket 1.

_II_brk2.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 1 is taxed at tax rate 2.

_II_rt3.description: The third lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 3 and above tax bracket 2.

_II_brk3.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 2 is taxed at tax rate 3.

_II_rt4.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 4 and above tax bracket 3.

_II_brk4.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 3 is taxed at tax rate 4.

_II_rt5.description: The third highest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 5 and above tax bracket 4.

_II_brk5.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 4 is taxed at tax rate 5.

_II_rt6.description: The second higher tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 6 and above tax bracket 5.

_II_brk6.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 5 is taxed at tax rate 6.

_II_rt7.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 7 and above tax bracket 6.

_II_brk7.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 6 is taxed at tax rate 7; income above this threshold is taxed at tax rate 8.  Default value is essentially infinity

_II_rt8.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income above tax bracket 7.

_PT_rt1.description: The lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 1.

_PT_brk1.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold is taxed at tax rate 1.

_PT_rt2.description: The second lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 2 and above tax bracket 1.

_PT_brk2.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 1 is taxed at tax rate 2.

_PT_rt3.description: The third lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 3 and above tax bracket 2.

_PT_brk3.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 2 is taxed at tax rate 3.

_PT_rt4.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 4 and above tax bracket 3.

_PT_brk4.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 3 is taxed at tax rate 4.

_PT_rt5.description: The third highest tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 5 and above tax bracket 4.

_PT_brk5.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 4 is taxed at tax rate 5.

_PT_rt6.description: The second higher tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 6 and above tax bracket 5.

_PT_brk6.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 5 is taxed at tax rate 6.

_PT_rt7.description: The highest tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below tax bracket 7 and above tax bracket 6.

_PT_brk7.description: Income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations below this threshold and above tax bracket 6 is taxed at tax rate 7. Default value is essentially infinity

_PT_rt8.description: The extra tax rate, applied to the portion of income from sole proprietorships, partnerships and S corporations above the tax bracket 7.

_AMT_em.description: The amount of AMT taxable income exempted from AMT.

_AMT_prt.description: AMT exemption will decrease at this rate for each dollar of AMT taxable income exceeding AMT phaseout start.

_AMT_em_ps.description: AMT exemption starts to decrease when AMT taxable income goes beyond this threshold.

_AMT_Child_em.long_name: Child AMT exemption additional income base
_AMT_Child_em.description: The child's AMT exemption is capped by this amount plus the child's earned income.

_AMT_KT_c_Age.long_name: Maximum age subject to Kiddie Tax
_AMT_KT_c_Age.description: At or under this age, the individual is subject to Kiddie Tax.

_AMT_rt1.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of AMT taxable income below the surtax threshold, AMT bracket 1.

_AMT_brk1.description: AMT taxable income below this is subject to AMT rate 1 and above it is subject to AMT rate 1 + the additional AMT rate.

_AMT_rt2.long_name: Additional AMT rate for AMT taxable income above AMT bracket 1
_AMT_rt2.description: The additional tax rate applied to the portion of AMT income above the AMT bracket 1.
_AMT_rt2.notes: This is the additional tax rate (on top of AMT rate 1) for AMT income above AMT bracket 1.

_AMT_em_pe.long_name: AMT exemption phaseout ending AMT taxable income for Married filling Separately
_AMT_em_pe.description: The AMT exemption is entirely disallowed beyond this AMT taxable income level for individuals who are married but filing separately.

_CDCC_c.long_name: Maximum child & dependent care credit per dependent
_CDCC_c.description: The maximum amount of credit allowed for each qualifying dependent.

_CDCC_ps.long_name: Child & dependent care credit phaseout start
_CDCC_ps.description: For taxpayers with AGI over this amount, the credit is reduced by one percentage point each $2000 of AGI over this amount.

_CDCC_crt.long_name: Child & dependent care credit phaseout percentage rate ceiling
_CDCC_crt.description: The maximum percentage rate in the AGI phaseout; this percentage rate decreases as AGI rises above the _CDCC_ps level.

_CTC_c.long_name: Maximum child tax credit per child
_CTC_c.description: The maximum amount of credit allowed for each child.
_CTC_c.irs_ref: form 1040, line 52, instructions (child tax credit worksheet, line 1).

_CTC_c_under5_bonus.long_name: Bonus child tax credit maximum for qualifying children under five
_CTC_c_under5_bonus.description: The maximum amount of child tax credit allowed for each child is increased by this amount for qualifying children under 5 years old.

_CTC_ps.long_name: Child tax credit phaseout MAGI start
_CTC_ps.description: Child tax credit begins to decrease when MAGI is above this level.

_CTC_prt.description: The amount of credit starts to decrease at this rate if MAGI is higher than child tax credit phaseout start.
_CTC_prt.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 52, instruction (child tax credit worksheet, line 5)

_DependentCredit_c.description: This nonrefundable credit is applied to dependents and phases out with the Child Tax Credit. The dependent credit's phaseout begins when the CTC's phaseout ends.
_DependentCredit_c.notes: The Ryan-Brady tax plan sets this at $500

_NIIT_thd.long_name: Net Investment Income Tax modified AGI threshold
_NIIT_thd.description: If modified AGI is more than this threshold, filing unit is subject to the Net Investment Income Tax.

_NIIT_PT_taxed.long_name: Whether or not partnership and S-corp income is in NIIT base
_NIIT_PT_taxed.description: false ==> partnership and S-corp income excluded from NIIT base; true ==> partnership and s-corp income is in NIIT base

_NIIT_rt.description: If modified AGI exceeds _NIIT_thd, all net investment income is taxed at this rate.

_EITC_c.description: This is the maximum amount of earned income credit taxpayers are eligible for; it depends on how many kids they have.

_EITC_rt.description: If one taxpayer's AGI is below AGI phaseout start, he can apply this rate to his earned income to calculate the credit amount eligible.
_EITC_rt.notes: Range of this parameter is between zero and one.

_EITC_prt.description: Earned income credit will decrease at the this rate when AGI is higher than EITC phaseout start.

_EITC_ps.long_name: Earned income credit phaseout AGI start
_EITC_ps.description: If AGI is higher than this threshold, the amount of EITC will start to decrease.

_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.long_name: EITC Phaseout Starting AGI (Married filling Jointly)
_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.description: This is the additional amount added on the regular EITC phaseout start, only for taxpayers with filling status of married filling jointly.
_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 66a&b, calculation (the difference between EIC phaseout bases of married jointly fillers and other fillers).

_EITC_MinEligAge.long_name: Minimum Age for Childless EITC Eligibility
_EITC_MinEligAge.description: For a childless filling unit, at least one individual's age needs to be no less than this age (but no greater than the EITC_MaxEligAge) in order to be eligible for an earned income tax credit.

_EITC_MaxEligAge.long_name: Maximum Age for Childless EITC Eligibility
_EITC_MaxEligAge.description: For a childless filling unit, at least one individual's age needs to be no greater than this age (but no less than the EITC_MinEligAge) in order to be eligible for an earned income tax credit.

_EITC_InvestIncome_c.description: The earned income credit may not be claimed by taxpayers whose investment income exceeds this limit.

_EITC_indiv.long_name: EITC is individual-based rather than filing-unit based
_EITC_indiv.description: Current-law value is false implying EITC is filing-unit based; a value of true implies EITC is computed for each individual wage earner.  The phase-out of the credit works slightly differently between the two.  Individual-based calculation ignore investment income and age eligibilty rules used in filing-unit-based calculations.

_LLC_Expense_c.description: The maximum expense eligible for lifetime learning credit, per child.

_ETC_pe_Single.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those taxpayers of single filing status with modified AGI (in thousands) higher than this level.

_ETC_pe_Married.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those taxpayers of married filing status with modified AGI level (in thousands) higher than this level.

_ACTC_rt.description: This is the fraction of earnings used in calculating the ACTC, which is a partially refundable credit that supplements the CTC for some taxpayers.

_ACTC_rt_bonus_under5family.long_name: Bonus additional child tax credit rate for families with qualifying children under 5
_ACTC_rt_bonus_under5family.description: For families with qualifying children under 5 years old, this bonus rate is added to the fraction of earnings (additional child tax credit rate) used in calculating the ACTC.

_ACTC_Income_thd.long_name: Additional Child Tax Credit income threshold
_ACTC_Income_thd.description: The portion of earned income below this threshold does not count as base for the Additional Child Tax Credit.

_ACTC_ChildNum.long_name: Additional Child Tax Credit minimum number of qualified children
_ACTC_ChildNum.description: Families with this number of qualified children or more may qualify for the Additional Child Tax Credit, which is a partially refundable credit that supplements the Child Tax Credit for some taxpayers.

_CTC_new_c.long_name: New refundable child tax credit maximum amount per child
_CTC_new_c.description: In addition to all credits currently available for dependents, this parameter gives each qualifying child a new refundable credit with this maximum amount.
_CTC_new_c.notes: Child age qualification for the new child tax credit is the same as under current-law Child Tax Credit.

_CTC_new_c_under5_bonus.long_name: Bonus new refundable child tax credit maximum for qualifying children under five
_CTC_new_c_under5_bonus.description: The maximum amount of the new refundable child tax credit allowed for each child is increased by this amount for qualifying children under 5 years old.

_CTC_new_rt.long_name: New refundable child tax credit amount phasein rate
_CTC_new_rt.description: The total amount of the new child tax credit is increased at this rate per dollar of AGI until _CTC_new_c times the number of qualified children is reached.
_CTC_new_rt.notes: Child age qualification for the new child tax credit is the same as under current-law Child Tax Credit.

_CTC_new_ps.long_name: New refundable child tax credit phaseout starting AGI
_CTC_new_ps.description: The total amount of new child tax credit is reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this level.

_CTC_new_prt.long_name: New refundable child tax credit amount phaseout rate
_CTC_new_prt.description: The total amount of the new child tax credit is reduced at this rate per dollar exceeding the phaseout starting AGI, _CTC_new_ps.

_CTC_new_refund_limited.long_name: New child tax credit refund limited to a decimal fraction of payroll taxes
_CTC_new_refund_limited.description: Specifies whether the new child tax credit refund is limited by the new child tax credit refund limit rate (_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt)
_CTC_new_refund_limited.notes: Set this parameter to true to limit the refundability or false to allow full refundability for all taxpayers.

_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.long_name: New child tax credit refund limit rate (decimal fraction of payroll taxes)
_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.description: The fraction of payroll taxes (employee plus employer shares, but excluding all Medicare payroll taxes) that serves as a limit to the amount of new child tax credit that can be refunded.
_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.notes: Set this parameter to zero for no refundability; set it to 9e99 for unlimited refundability for taxpayers with payroll tax liabilities.

_FST_AGI_trt.long_name: New minimum tax; rate as a decimal fraction of AGI
_FST_AGI_trt.description: Individual income taxes and the employee share of payroll taxes are credited against this minimum tax, so the surtax is the difference between the tax rate times AGI and the credited taxes. The new minimum tax is similar to the Fair Share Tax, except that no credits are exempted from the base.

_FST_AGI_thd_lo.long_name: Minimum AGI needed to be subject to the new minimum tax
_FST_AGI_thd_lo.description: A taxpayer is only subject to the new minimum tax if they exceed this level of AGI

_FST_AGI_thd_hi.long_name: AGI level at which the New Minimum Tax is fully phased in
_FST_AGI_thd_hi.description: The new minimum tax will be fully phased in at this level of AGI. If there is no phase-in, this upper threshold should be set equal to the lower AGI threshold

_AGI_surtax_trt.description: The surtax rate is applied to the portion of Adjusted Gross Income above the AGI surtax threshold.

_AGI_surtax_thd.long_name: Threshold for the new AGI surtax
_AGI_surtax_thd.description: The aggregate gross income above this AGI surtax threshold is taxed at surtax rate on AGI.

_LST.description: The lump-sum tax is available to every member of a tax filing unit. The lump-sum tax is included only in combined taxes; it is not included in income or payroll taxes.

_UBI1.description: Lump sum of money given to people under 18

_UBI2.description: Lump sum of money given to people aged 18-20

_UBI3.description: Lump sum of money given to people 21 and over

_UBI_ecrt.long_name: Fraction of UBI benefits excluded from AGI
_UBI_ecrt.description: One minus this fraction of UBI is taxable and will be added to AGI

_CR_RetirementSavings_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the retirement savings credit that can be claimed
_CR_RetirementSavings_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Retirement Savings Credit

_CR_ForeignTax_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the foreign tax credit that can be claimed
_CR_ForeignTax_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Foreign Tax Credit

_CR_ResidentialEnergy_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the residential energy credit that can be claimed
_CR_ResidentialEnergy_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Residential Energy Credit

_CR_GeneralBusiness_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the general business credit that can be claimed
_CR_GeneralBusiness_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * General Business Credit

_CR_MinimumTax_hc.long_name: Credit for previous year minimum tax credit haircut
_CR_MinimumTax_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the previous year minimum tax credit that can be claimed
_CR_MinimumTax_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Previous Year Minimum Tax Credit

_CR_AmOppRefundable_hc.long_name: Refundable portion of the American Opportunity Credit haircut
_CR_AmOppRefundable_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the refundable American Opportunity credit that can be claimed
_CR_AmOppRefundable_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Refundable Portion of the American Opportunity Credit

_CR_AmOppNonRefundable_hc.long_name: Nonrefundable portion of the American Opportunity Credit haircut
_CR_AmOppNonRefundable_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the nonrefundable American Opportunity credit that can be claimed
_CR_AmOppNonRefundable_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * NonRefundable Portion of the American Opportunity Credit

_CR_SchR_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of Schedule R credit that can be claimed
_CR_SchR_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Schedule R Credit

_CR_OtherCredits_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of other credit that can be claimed
_CR_OtherCredits_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Other Credits

_CR_Education_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of education credits that can be claimed
_CR_Education_hc.notes: Credit claimed will be (1. - Haircut) * Education Credits

_SS_em.long_name: Social Security payroll tax exemption amount
_SS_em.description: Subtracted from Social Security payroll tax in the calculation of Social Security payroll tax, per filing unit.

_SS_em_ps.long_name: Social Security payroll tax exemption phaseout starting income
_SS_em_ps.description: If taxpayers' AGI is above this level, their personal exemption will start to decrease at the personal exemption phaseout rate (PEP provision).

_SS_prt.long_name: Social Security payroll tax personal exemption phaseout rate
_SS_prt.description: Personal exemption amount will decrease by this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding exemption phaseout start.

_SS_credit.long_name: Social Security payroll tax refundable credit maximum amount
_SS_credit.description: This credit amount is fully refundable. Currently, there is no phaseout built in

_FICA_em.long_name: Medicare payroll tax personal and dependent exemption amount
_FICA_em.description: Subtracted from Medicare payroll tax in the calculation of the Medicare payroll tax  income, per filing unit.

_FICA_em_ps.long_name: Medicare payroll tax exemption phaseout starting income
_FICA_em_ps.description: If taxpayers' AGI is above this level, their personal exemption will start to decrease at the personal exemption phaseout rate (PEP provision).

_FICA_prt.long_name: Medicare payroll tax personal exemption phaseout rate
_FICA_prt.description: Medicare payroll tax personal exemption amount will decrease by this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding exemption phaseout start.

_FICA_credit.long_name: Medicare payroll tax refundable credit maximum amount
_FICA_credit.description: This credit amount is fully refundable. Currently, there is no phaseout built in
